channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: The Morning After: Samsung's new family of Galaxy Book laptops
item.description: Today’s headlines: iPhone and Mac sales are way up from the start of the pandemic, Samsung unveils a new family of Galaxy Book laptops and CES plans a return as an in-person event in 2022.

item.title: Roku's Streambar falls to $100 at HSN
item.description: You can now pick up a Roku Streambar at HSN for $100, a $30 discount and one of the best prices we've seen yet.

item.title: Amazon to increase the pay of over 500,000 workers amid union battles
item.description: Amazon will give workers a pay rise of between 50 cents and $300 as part of an early wage review, the retailer said on Wednesday.

item.title: Sony begins selling the PS5 in China
item.description: Sony has officially launched the PlayStation 5 in China ahead of Microsoft's Xbox consoles.

item.title: Microsoft is fixing the pain of arranging Windows 10 apps on multiple displays
item.description: If you use a multi-monitor setup on Windows 10 for gaming, work or because they're built right into your laptop, Microsoft has some good news.

item.title: Apple Watch Series 6 price falls again to a new low of $249
item.description: The Apple Watch Series 6 Product Red edition is now down to $249 at Best Buy, marking an all-time low for the bestelling smartwatch.

item.title: Atomos Ninja V+ brings 8K ProRes RAW support to Canon's EOS R5
item.description: Atomos has introduced a new external recorder/monitor that makes 8K or 4K 120p ProRes RAW recording possible on select mirrorless and pro cameras.

item.title: Bang & Olufsen's Beolab 28 is a $14,750 pair of connected speakers
item.description: Bang & Olufsen's latest high-end wireless speakers are equipped mechanical curtains that move to adjust how the speakers project sound.

item.title: NASA wants to go farther and faster for fourth Mars helicopter flight
item.description: NASA has announced that the helicopter's fourth flight is scheduled to take off on April 29th at 10:12 AM Eastern time.

item.title: Samsung's profits rose in Q1, but the chip shortage looms over Q2
item.description: Samsung's consumer electronics profits hit a new record high for Q1, but the company warned investors that sales will slow in Q2 due to component shortages.

item.title: Facebook Marketplace has 1 billion users
item.description: Facebook’s push into e-commerce features is starting to pay off.

item.title: Google Assistant will let you teach it how to pronounce tricky names
item.description: Google is introducing a handful new updates that will make Assistant better at pronouncing tricky names and understanding the context of conversations you share with it.

item.title: HBO Max will reportedly drop to $10 per month if you accept ads
item.description: When AT&T debuts HBO Max's new ad-supported tier in June, it will cost $10 per month, according to a report from CNBC.

item.title: iPhone and Mac sales are way up from the start of the pandemic
item.description: Apple is still riding high on the tails of a blockbuster quarter, according to a new earnings statement released today. Over the past three months, the company recorded a total of $89.6 billion in revenue — nearly $48 billion of which came courtesy of iPhone sales — and set another quarterly record in the process.

item.title: Facebook temporarily blocked searches for 'resignModi'
item.description: Facebook temporarily blocked searches for a hashtag that called for the resignation of India’s prime minister.

item.title: Stadia store upgrade will let you search for games
item.description: You would think the first thing a Google engineer would add to any product is a search bar, but not so with Stadia, which has been without the feature since it came out in 2019.

item.title: GM's Ultium Charge 360 project provides access to almost 60,000 EV plugs
item.description: The first Ultium-ready EV charging sites are now live in three states.

item.title: Epic is deliberately keeping 'Fortnite' off Microsoft's Xbox Cloud Game service
item.description: Epic sees the platform as competitive with its PC offerings.

item.title: The Ascend is a robotic knee brace on a budget
item.description: Bay Area startup Roam Robotics has a less intensive and expensive means of getting folks with mobility issues back on their feet. It’s called the Ascend and it’s a sub-$10k exoskeletal knee brace for everybody.

item.title: Apollo 11 astronaut Michael Collins dies at 90
item.description: Collins flew Apollo 11's command module around the Moon as Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin visited the surface.

item.title: Watch Samsung's Galaxy Book Pro event in 10 minutes
item.description: We recap everything Samsung announced at its recent Unpacked event devoted to the company's Galaxy Book laptop lineup.

item.title: Android earthquake alerts are now live in Greece and New Zealand
item.description: Google is rolling out its Android earthquake detection feature in New Zealand and Greece after launching the system in parts of the US.

item.title: You can now book a COVID-19 vaccine through Uber
item.description: You'll also be able to reserve a rental car and have a valet drop it off.

item.title: Fukushima's nuclear meltdown hasn't been the environmental calamity we feared
item.description: Despite the initial fallout from the Fukushima Daiichi incident the massive ecological disaster that many initially feared has, so far, failed to materialize.

item.title: Samsung's Galaxy Book will start at $800 in the US later this year
item.description: A more affordable but still sophisticated laptop.
